sentence.Network_en: He tried to insinuate himself into the boss's favor.
sentence.Network_cn: 他设法巧妙地渐渐取得老板的欢心.

sentence.Network_en: It'seems to me you insinuate things about her.
sentence.Network_cn: 我觉得你讲起她来,总有些弦外之音.

sentence.Network_en: And do you mean to insinuate that there is not a sort of devotion in that?
sentence.Network_cn: 难道你还能拐弯儿抹角儿地说这不算是赤胆忠心 吗 ?

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...(tableau)，金盘是高原(plateau)，金哥占卜者(augur)，e加螺丝钻(auger)里面四牛在暗示(insinuate)，前面mate灵长类(primate)里面书店在安装(install)，里面仍然在滴注(instill).

list.abs: insinuation at its root has not been proved., 这些暗示的根源并没有被证实.
The cat insinuated itself into the larder ., 那只猫悄悄地溜进食品室.
insinuate中文 ... 使肿胀 puff from 使逐渐而巧妙地进入 insinuate into 使注意 hold the attention of to.
综二讲义 - 存档 - 英语学习|英语考试论坛 ... desolate： 荒凉的 insinuate into: 迂回地潜入 come from: 来自.
they insinuate that Israel had Hariri killed and that the effect of these events on Syria stands to benefit Israel more than any other country .他们暗示说，以色列刺杀了哈里里，而且相对于其它国家，(最近)这些事件对叙利亚的影响一定是对以色列更为有利。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (used in legal contexts in the sense 'enter (a document) on the official register'): from Latin insinuat- 'introduced tortuously', from the verb insinuare, from in- 'in' + sinuare 'to curve'

entry.tran: 含沙射影地说;旁敲侧击地指出;暗示
entry.def: If you say that someone insinuates that something bad is the case, you mean that they say it in an indirect way.

example.ex: The libel claim followed an article which insinuated that the President was lying...
example.tran: 一篇文章因含沙射影声称总统撒谎而遭到诽谤索赔。

example.ex: Are you insinuating that I smell?
example.tran: 你是在旁敲侧击地说我身上有臭味吗？

entry.tran: 使逐渐而巧妙地取得;使迂回潜入(或挤入)
entry.def: If you say that someone insinuates themselves into a particular situation, you mean that they manage very cleverly, and perhaps dishonestly, to get into that situation.

example.ex: He gradually insinuated himself into her life.
example.tran: 他处心积虑终于一步步走进了她的生活。

means.word_mean: 1. introduce or insert (oneself) in a subtle manner;

sentences.sentence: "He insinuated himself into the conversation of the people at the nearby table"
"I insinuated that I did not like his wife"

auth_sentence.content: The tunes tend to insinuate themselves after several airings.
auth_sentence.res_content: The tunes tend to insinuate themselves after several airings.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The tunes tend to insinuate themselves after several airings.

auth_sentence.content: However, trying to insinuate that people can force this same outcome just by thinking positively is ridiculous.
auth_sentence.res_content: However, trying to insinuate that people can force this same outcome just by thinking positively is ridiculous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: However, trying to insinuate that people can force this same outcome just by thinking positively is ridiculous.

auth_sentence.content: You insinuate I don't see the value of the space shuttle program, but I do and spell that out albeit briefly in this post.
auth_sentence.res_content: You insinuate I don't see the value of the space shuttle program, but I do and spell that out albeit briefly in this post.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You insinuate I don't see the value of the space shuttle program, but I do and spell that out albeit briefly in this post.

stems_affixes.word_buile: sinu弯曲+ate……的→adj.弯弯曲曲的,波状的
sinuate[adj.弯弯曲曲的,波状的]+ion表名词→n.曲折
in+sinuate[adj.弯弯曲曲的,波状的]→v.暗指,暗示

sentences.en: He insinuated that I was lying.
She cleverly insinuated herself into his family.
sentences.cn: 她巧妙地混进了他的家庭。
